articles.title: U.K. to offer vaccines to some gay, bisexual men for monkeypox - CTV News
articles.description: British health officials will start offering vaccines to some men who are gay or bisexual or have sex with men, who are at the highest risk of catching monkeypox, in an effort to curb the biggest outbreak of the disease beyond Africa.

articles.title: Man contracted new antibiotic-resistant 'super gonorrhea' strain after having sex on holiday - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: This is the second time a "super gonorrhea" strain has been detected. Another multi-drug resistant strain was found in 2018 in multiple countries.
articles.content:
An Austrian man who had sex abroad caught a new strain of so-called "super gonorrhea" that is resistant to most antibiotics commonly used to treat the infection, scientists have said.

articles.title: Uncapped mobile broadband in South Africa — why networks throttle your connection - MyBroadband

articles.title: Vodacom has spent R1.7 billion on batteries in the past two years - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: Vodacom Group CEO, Shameel Joosub says the mobile operator has spent R1.7 billion on batteries as a response to load shedding. Rampent battery theft has, however, created another problem.
articles.content:
• Vodacom has spent R1.7 billion in the past two years.
  • This move was a response to the energy crisis.
  • Though this investment has paid off, battery theft has become an issue.
